SECTION.SUBTITLE: WHY WE COLLECT INFORMATION
THE INFORMATION WE COLLECT
SECTION.SUBTEXT:
Through our website, kiosks, your wireless device utilizing the William Hill Mobile Sports App, our Ticket Writers, and the remote account wagering registration process we collect Personal and Non-Personal Information (as defined below).
PERSONAL INFORMATION is data that can be used to uniquely identify or contact a single person.
•Registration Information. When you register for or use our Services and download the William Hill Mobile Sports App, we may collect “Personal Information” from you, such as your name, date of birth, mailing address, email address, mobile phone number, wireless carrier, telephone number, and fax number through which you can be identified. We may also ask you for Personal Information such as your credit or debit card number, financial account number, driver's license number, state identification card number, Social Security number, passport number, naturalization number, and/or the beneficiary of your William Hill money bearing account (i.e., your William Hill remote wagering account), which when combined with your name is then deemed “Confidential Personal Information“.
NON-PERSONAL INFORMATION is information about you or your activities through which you cannot be personally identified. In situations where it is possible to do so, Non-Personal Information may be linked to Personal Information. Non-Personal Information includes:
•Profile Information. When using our Services you may provide other information such as interests and hobbies, age, gender, relationship status, purchase information, favorite sports type and team preference, fan affiliation and wagering activity. We call this “Profile Information.”
•Location Information. To provide our Services to you, we collect and use information related to the actual geographic location of your wireless device; we obtain this information from your wireless carrier, certain third-party service providers, or directly from the wireless device you used to register for our Services.
•Cookies and other technologies. When you use our Services we may send and access one or more cookies (a small amount of data which often includes an anonymous unique identifier which is sent to your browser from a website or computer and stored on your hardware). We use cookies to remember personal information when you use our website, online services, and applications. We may use this information during your subsequent visits. Please review your web browser “Help” file to learn how to modify your cookie settings.
•Log File Information. When you use our Services, our servers automatically gather and store certain information about your usage. These server logs may include information such as a wireless device identification number and device identifier, web requests, Internet Protocol (“IP”) address, browser type, browser language, referring / exit pages and URLs, platform type, number of clicks, domain names, search terms, ratings, landing pages, pages viewed and the order of those pages, features used in our Services, our wireless application(s), alerts received, advertisements delivered, the amount of time spent on particular screens, the dates and times of your requests, and one or more cookies that may uniquely identify your browser.

SECTION.SUBTITLE: HOW WE USE INFORMATION
SECTION.SUBTEXT:
Except for Confidential Personal Information, we may use Personal Information and Non-Personal Information for our own marketing purposes, including notifying you of special promotions, offers and events specifically tailored to you and your special interests via mail, email, telephone, text message, and other means. Confidential Personal Information will not be used for our own marketing purposes without your express consent.
•With your consent, we use your Confidential Personal Information, Personal Information, and Non-Personal Information to enable us to set up, operate, and manage your remote wagering account, and to provide to you, and maintain, all of the features (including text invitations to private contests or tournaments, alerts to changes in the odds or close of betting session for a game, injury reports, or winning a game, a contest or a tournament, and updates to the William Hill Mobile Sports App) and functionality of our Services.
•With your consent, we also use your location information to determine whether (i) you are in a jurisdiction where our Services are lawful, (ii) your wireless device matches your account while you are in the William Hill Services approved jurisdiction, (iii) which of our Services alerts are relevant to you. We reserve the right to use your anonymous location information for other purposes.
•We may also use your Personal Information and Non-Personal Information (such as location and anonymous log file information) to track and analyze your user preferences and trends to improve the quality and design of our Services and to create new features, promotions, functionality, and services.
•We may further use cookies and log file information to: (i) remember information so you will not have to re-enter it during your visit or the next time you use or visit our Services, (ii) provide custom and personalized content, advertisements, and information, (iii) monitor the effectiveness of our marketing campaigns, and (iv) monitor aggregate usage metrics.
•We may also use a third-party data source to verify your mobile phone number is on a wireless provider we support. If you have a supported mobile phone number and device, then we may send a text message to your phone in order to verify your custody of that handset. If your carrier or handset is not supported, then we may store your mobile phone number and may send a one-time text message to you when our Services become available on your wireless provider or handset.
•We may use your email address or mobile number from time-to-time to send you messages from us such as privacy or security related notices, notifying you of major updates to our Services, or for other customer service purposes.

SECTION.SUBTEXT:

SECTION.SUBTITLE: THIRD-PARTY ADVERTISERS AND AD-SERVING COMPANIES
SECTION.SUBTEXT: Third-party advertisers or ad network companies may sometimes deliver (“or serve”) advertisements, that may appear on our website, directly to users. These companies may automatically receive your IP address or other information about your wireless device or personal computer when serving advertisements. These third parties may also download cookies to your computer, or use other technologies such as JavaScript and “web beacons” (also known as “1×1 gifs”) to measure the effectiveness of the advertisements served and to personalize advertising content. Doing this allows the advertiser or ad network to recognize your computer or wireless device each time they send you an advertisement in order to measure the effectiveness of the ad and to personalize advertising content. These companies may compile information about the sites or services visited when seeing advertisements and determine which advertisements are clicked. We do not access or have control of the cookies that these third-party advertisers or ad networks may place. Likewise, third party advertisers and ad networks do not have access to your personal information stored with us unless you choose to share it with them. This Privacy Policy does not cover the use of tracking technologies or personal data by any such third-party advertisers or ad networks. We encourage you to learn about the privacy practices of those third parties.
